comments.body: I know filesystem ops are synchronous, but I wonder if this could be a bottleneck when we want to create lots of directories.  Would it make sense to offer an async version or leave it as a task to the user?
This will run on Akka's IO Dispatcher so it is async. What kind of async do you have in mind?
I mean should we use `mapAsync` with some default parallelism when creating directories?

I don't think that's useful. It would require wrapping it in a `Future` which would need an execution context.
In the end, the file system is a giant shared resource with a big semaphore somewhere. Creating directories in parallel might even show strange behaviour.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@  def mkdirs(): Flow[Path, Path, NotUsed] =
    Flow[Path]
      .map(Files.createDirectories(_))
      .addAttributes(ActorAttributes.dispatcher(ActorAttributes.IODispatcher.dispatcher))
